SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01715
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01715 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=barxxx'+or+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=barxxx'+or+7%3d5-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=barxxx'+or+7%3d7-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=barxxx'+or+5%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d's HTTP/1.1

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.

If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 't'='t which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 't'='t

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=bar'+and+'t'%3d't HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 't'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is bar' and 't'='r

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01715?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest01715=bar'+and+'t'%3d'r HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01712?username=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest01712=verifyUserPassword%26%23x28%3b%26%23x27%3bfoo%26%23x27%3b%2c%26%23x27%3bbar%26%23x27%3b%26%23x29%3b
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01712
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01712 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01712?username=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest01712=2%2b1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01712?username=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest01712=1%2b2 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01712?username=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest01712=3%2ba HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01712?username=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest01712=3%2bb HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01627
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01627 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=ff&password=ff&BenchmarkTest01627=barxxx'+or+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=ff&password=ff&BenchmarkTest01627=barxxx'+or+7%3d5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=ff&password=ff&BenchmarkTest01627=barxxx'+or+7%3d7--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=ff&password=ff&BenchmarkTest01627=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 's'='s
Payload B - bar' and 's'='r
Payload C - bar' and 't'='t
Payload D - bar' and 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627
Affected Parameter:JSESSIONID
Parameter Location:Cookie
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the JSESSIONID parameter of the Cookie section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent three payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - A"||"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796
Payload B - A"+"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796
Payload C - A" "EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796
Payload A is trying to concatenate two strings as per the SQL syntax of Oracle database servers. Payload B is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per SQL syntax of MS SQL database servers. Payload C is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per the SQL syntax of MySQL database servers.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and is different from the response received for Payloads B. This indicates that the application was actually trying to perform the string concatenation on the server-side and that the backend database in use is MS SQL. Since incase of MS SQL database server Payloads A & C would have simply thrown an invalid SQL syntax exception their responses are similar. And Payload B would have executed without this error and so its response was different than the other two.
If the application was not actually performing the concatenation then all three payload should have received very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the three payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different strings and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per Oracle database's syntax. The payload is A"||"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=A"||"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used MS SQL database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used MySQL database's concatenation syntax

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MS SQL database's syntax. The payload is A"+"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=A"+"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the responses recieved for the payloads that used MySQL and Oracle databases' concatenation syntax.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MySQL database's syntax. The payload is A" "EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01627 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=A"%20"EAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used MS SQL database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used Oracle database's concatenation syntax

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01718?username=hhh&password=hhh&BenchmarkTest01718=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01718
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01718 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 's'='s
Payload B - bar' and 's'='r
Payload C - bar' and 't'='t
Payload D - bar' and 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 's'='s

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01718?username=hhh&password=hhh&BenchmarkTest01718=bar'+and+'s'%3d's HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 's'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is bar' and 's'='r

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01718?username=hhh&password=hhh&BenchmarkTest01718=bar'+and+'s'%3d'r HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 't'='t which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 't'='t

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01718?username=hhh&password=hhh&BenchmarkTest01718=bar'+and+'t'%3d't HTTP/1.1

Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01716?username=zzzzz&password=zzzzz&BenchmarkTest01716=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01716
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01716 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01716?username=zzzzz&password=zzzzz&BenchmarkTest01716=barxxx'+or+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01716?username=zzzzz&password=zzzzz&BenchmarkTest01716=barxxx'+or+7%3d5-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01730?username=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest01730=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01730
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01730 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='t which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='t

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01730?username=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest01730=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d't HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='r

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01730?username=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest01730=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d'r HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01730?username=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest01730=bar'+and+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is bar' and 7=5--

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-03/BenchmarkTest01731?username=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest01731=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest01731
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest01731 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

Reason 2:

Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r

<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02169
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02169 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=bb&password=bb&BenchmarkTest02169=2%2b1

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=bb&password=bb&BenchmarkTest02169=1%2b2

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=bb&password=bb&BenchmarkTest02169=3%2b5

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=bb&password=bb&BenchmarkTest02169=2%2b6

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=bb&password=bb&BenchmarkTest02169=3%2ba

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02169 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=bb&password=bb&BenchmarkTest02169=3%2bb

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02171
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02171
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02171 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02171 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02171=barxxx'+or+8%3d8--&BenchmarkTest02171=Movies&BenchmarkTest02171=Writing&BenchmarkTest02171=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02171 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02171=barxxx'+or+7%3d5--&BenchmarkTest02171=Movies&BenchmarkTest02171=Writing&BenchmarkTest02171=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02171 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02171=barxxx'+or+7%3d7--&BenchmarkTest02171=Movies&BenchmarkTest02171=Writing&BenchmarkTest02171=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02171 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02171=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--&BenchmarkTest02171=Movies&BenchmarkTest02171=Writing&BenchmarkTest02171=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02170
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02170 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=ggg&productID=ggg&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02170=2%2b1

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=ggg&productID=ggg&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02170=1%2b2

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=ggg&productID=ggg&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02170=3%2b5

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=ggg&productID=ggg&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02170=2%2b6

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=ggg&productID=ggg&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02170=3%2ba

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02170 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=ggg&productID=ggg&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02170=3%2bb

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02269
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02269
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02269 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02269 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest02269=barxxx'+or+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02269 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest02269=barxxx'+or+7%3d5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02269 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest02269=barxxx'+or+7%3d7--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02269 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=uuuuu&password=uuuuu&BenchmarkTest02269=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02270
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02270
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02270 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--

The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
