[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=pppp&productID=pppp&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02270=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d't

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='r

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02270 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=pppp&productID=pppp&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02270=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d'r

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-04/BenchmarkTest02270 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=pppp&productID=pppp&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02270=bar'+and+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Reason 4:

Payload A - bar' and 's'='s
Payload B - bar' and 's'='r
Payload C - bar' and 't'='t
Payload D - bar' and 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.

If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02284
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02284
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02284 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent three payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - b'||'ar
Payload B - b'+'ar
Payload C - b' 'ar
Payload A is trying to concatenate two strings as per the SQL syntax of Oracle database servers. Payload B is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per SQL syntax of MS SQL database servers. Payload C is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per the SQL syntax of MySQL database servers.
The response for Payload B and C were similar to each other and is different from the response received for Payloads A. This indicates that the application was actually trying to perform the string concatenation on the server-side and that the backend database in use is Oracle. Since incase of Oracle database server Payloads B & C would have simply thrown an invalid SQL syntax exception their responses are similar. And Payload A would have executed without this error and so its response was different than the other two.
If the application was not actually performing the concatenation then all three payload should have received very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the three payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different strings and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per Oracle database's syntax. The payload is b'||'ar

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02284 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=cc&password=cc&BenchmarkTest02284=b'%7c%7c'ar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the responses recieved for the payloads that used MS SQL and MySQL databases' concatenation syntax.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MS SQL database's syntax. The payload is b'+'ar

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02284 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=cc&password=cc&BenchmarkTest02284=b'%2b'ar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used Oracle database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used MySQL database's concatenation syntax

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MySQL database's syntax. The payload is b' 'ar

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02284 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=cc&password=cc&BenchmarkTest02284=b'+'ar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used Oracle database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used MS SQL database's concatenation syntax

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=cc&password=cc&BenchmarkTest02284=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 's'='s
Payload B - bar' and 's'='r
Payload C - bar' and 't'='t
Payload D - bar' and 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02449
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02449 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=cc&productID=cc&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02449=2%2b1

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=cc&productID=cc&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02449=1%2b2

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=cc&productID=cc&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02449=3%2b5

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=cc&productID=cc&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02449=2%2b6

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=cc&productID=cc&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02449=3%2ba

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02449 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=cc&productID=cc&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02449=3%2bb

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02450
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02450
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02450 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent three payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - M'||'ovies
Payload B - M'+'ovies
Payload C - M' 'ovies
Payload A is trying to concatenate two strings as per the SQL syntax of Oracle database servers. Payload B is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per SQL syntax of MS SQL database servers. Payload C is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per the SQL syntax of MySQL database servers.
The response for Payload A and B were similar to each other and is different from the response received for Payloads C. This indicates that the application was actually trying to perform the string concatenation on the server-side and that the backend database in use is MySQL. Since incase of MySQL database server Payloads A & B would have simply thrown an invalid SQL syntax exception their responses are similar. And Payload C would have executed without this error and so its response was different than the other two.
If the application was not actually performing the concatenation then all three payload should have received very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the three payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different strings and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per Oracle database's syntax. The payload is M'||'ovies

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02450 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02450=bar&BenchmarkTest02450=M'%7c%7c'ovies&BenchmarkTest02450=Writing&BenchmarkTest02450=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used MySQL database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used MS SQL database's concatenation syntax

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MS SQL database's syntax. The payload is M'+'ovies

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02450 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02450=bar&BenchmarkTest02450=M'%2b'ovies&BenchmarkTest02450=Writing&BenchmarkTest02450=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used MySQL database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used Oracle database's concatenation syntax

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MySQL database's syntax. The payload is M' 'ovies

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02450 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02450=bar&BenchmarkTest02450=M'+'ovies&BenchmarkTest02450=Writing&BenchmarkTest02450=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the responses recieved for the payloads that used Oracle and MS SQL databases' concatenation syntax.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02528
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02528 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=jjj&password=jjj&BenchmarkTest02528=2%2b1

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=jjj&password=jjj&BenchmarkTest02528=1%2b2

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=jjj&password=jjj&BenchmarkTest02528=3%2b5

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=jjj&password=jjj&BenchmarkTest02528=2%2b6

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=jjj&password=jjj&BenchmarkTest02528=3%2ba

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02528 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=jjj&password=jjj&BenchmarkTest02528=3%2bb

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02534
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02534 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+7%3d5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+7%3d7--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d's

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='r

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d'r

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='t which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='t

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d't

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='r

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d'r

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=bar'+and+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is bar' and 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

secure=yyyyy&productID=yyyyy&foo=foo&BenchmarkTest02534=bar'+and+7%3d5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02534 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]

Information about the Response from the Server:

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02530
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02530 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02530=2%2b1&BenchmarkTest02530=Movies&BenchmarkTest02530=Writing&BenchmarkTest02530=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02530=1%2b2&BenchmarkTest02530=Movies&BenchmarkTest02530=Writing&BenchmarkTest02530=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02530=3%2b5&BenchmarkTest02530=Movies&BenchmarkTest02530=Writing&BenchmarkTest02530=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02530=2%2b6&BenchmarkTest02530=Movies&BenchmarkTest02530=Writing&BenchmarkTest02530=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02530=3%2ba&BenchmarkTest02530=Movies&BenchmarkTest02530=Writing&BenchmarkTest02530=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02530 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02530=3%2bb&BenchmarkTest02530=Movies&BenchmarkTest02530=Writing&BenchmarkTest02530=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02533
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02533
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02533 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02533 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest02533=barxxx'+or+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02533 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest02533=barxxx'+or+7%3d5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02533 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest02533=barxxx'+or+7%3d7--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02533 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

email=yyyyy&password=yyyyy&BenchmarkTest02533=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:

If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02535
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02535
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02535 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02535 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02535=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--&BenchmarkTest02535=Movies&BenchmarkTest02535=Writing&BenchmarkTest02535=Singing&foo=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02535 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

BenchmarkTest02535=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d's&BenchmarkTest02535=Movies&BenchmarkTest02535=Writing&BenchmarkTest02535=Singing&foo=bar

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02542?username=kkk&password=kkk&BenchmarkTest02542=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02542
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02542 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 4:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 's'='s
Payload B - bar' and 's'='r
Payload C - bar' and 't'='t
Payload D - bar' and 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 's'='s

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=AEAC4CAB96B6902A1B50A51ABD5C6796

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02543
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02543
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02543 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
