SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02542?username=lll&password=lll&BenchmarkTest02542=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02542
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02542 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02543
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02543
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02543 parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02543 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

email=lll&password=lll&BenchmarkTest02543=barxxx'+or+8%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02543 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

email=lll&password=lll&BenchmarkTest02543=barxxx'+or+7%3d5--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02543 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

email=lll&password=lll&BenchmarkTest02543=barxxx'+or+7%3d7--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02543 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

email=lll&password=lll&BenchmarkTest02543=barxxx'+or+5%3d8--

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 's'='s
Payload B - bar' and 's'='r
Payload C - bar' and 't'='t
Payload D - bar' and 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=verifyUserPassword%26%23x28%3b%26%23x27%3bfoo%26%23x27%3b%2c%26%23x27%3bbar%26%23x27%3b%26%23x29%3b
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02625
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02625 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=2%2b1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=1%2b2 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=3%2b5 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=2%2b6 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=3%2ba HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02625?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02625=3%2bb HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02627?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02627=verifyUserPassword%26%23x28%3b%26%23x27%3bfoo%26%23x27%3b%2c%26%23x27%3bbar%26%23x27%3b%26%23x29%3b
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02627
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02627 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02544
Affected Parameter:foo
Parameter Location:Body
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the foo parameter of the Body section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent three payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - f"||"oo
Payload B - f"+"oo
Payload C - f" "oo
Payload A is trying to concatenate two strings as per the SQL syntax of Oracle database servers. Payload B is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per SQL syntax of MS SQL database servers. Payload C is trying to concatenate the same two strings as per the SQL syntax of MySQL database servers.
The response for Payload A and B were similar to each other and is different from the response received for Payloads C. This indicates that the application was actually trying to perform the string concatenation on the server-side and that the backend database in use is MySQL. Since incase of MySQL database server Payloads A & B would have simply thrown an invalid SQL syntax exception their responses are similar. And Payload C would have executed without this error and so its response was different than the other two.
If the application was not actually performing the concatenation then all three payload should have received very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the three payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different strings and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per Oracle database's syntax. The payload is f"||"oo

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02544 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

secure=lll&productID=lll&foo=f%22%7c%7c%22oo&BenchmarkTest02544=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used MySQL database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used MS SQL database's concatenation syntax

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MS SQL database's syntax. The payload is f"+"oo

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02544 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

secure=lll&productID=lll&foo=f%22%2b%22oo&BenchmarkTest02544=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the response recieved for the payloads that used MySQL database's concatenation syntax but similar to the response for the payload that used Oracle database's concatenation syntax

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to concatenate two strings as per MySQL database's syntax. The payload is f" "oo

POST http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02544 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

secure=lll&productID=lll&foo=f%22+%22oo&BenchmarkTest02544=bar

Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is different from the responses recieved for the payloads that used Oracle and MS SQL databases' concatenation syntax.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=verifyUserPassword%26%23x28%3b%26%23x27%3bfoo%26%23x27%3b%2c%26%23x27%3bbar%26%23x27%3b%26%23x29%3b
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02628
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02628 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=2%2b1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 1 and 2.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=1%2b2 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=3%2b5 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=2%2b6 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=3%2ba HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02628?username=dd&password=dd&BenchmarkTest02628=3%2bb HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02632
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02632 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+7%3d5-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+7%3d7-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+5%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d's HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='r

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d'r HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='t which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='t

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d't HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='r

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d'r HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=bar'+and+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is bar' and 7=5--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02632?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02632=bar'+and+7%3d5-- HTTP/1.1

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02630?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02630=verifyUserPassword%26%23x28%3b%26%23x27%3bfoo%26%23x27%3b%2c%26%23x27%3bbar%26%23x27%3b%26%23x29%3b
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02630
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02630 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reason:
Reason:
IronWASP sent six payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - 2+1
Payload B - 1+2
Payload C - 3+5
Payload D - 2+6
Payload E - 3+a
Payload F - 3+b
Payload A and B is the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 3. Payload C and D is also the addition of two numbers whose sum would be 8. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts as a number is being added to a string.
The response for Payload A and B is similar to each other and is different from Payloads C, D, E and F. This indicates that the application actually performed the addition of the two numbers in the Payload A and B. Since they add up to the same value their responses are similar. Payloads C and D add up to different values. Payload E and F are invalid addition attempts. If the application was not actually performing addition then all six payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the six payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with different numbers and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 1.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02630?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02630=2%2b1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 3 and 5.

Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request tries to add the numbers 2 and 6.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02630?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02630=2%2b6 HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string a.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02630?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02630=3%2ba HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request is an invalid attempt to add the number 3 with string b.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02630?username=ee&password=ee&BenchmarkTest02630=3%2bb HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

Refer to the 'Reasons' section of this vulnerabilty's description to understand how to interpret this response.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02635
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02635 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=barxxx'+or+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 7=5--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=barxxx'+or+7%3d5-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 7=7-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 7=7--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=barxxx'+or+7%3d7-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 5=8-- which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 5=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=barxxx'+or+5%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=barxxx'+or+'s'%3d's HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d'r HTTP/1.1

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-05/BenchmarkTest02635?username=xxxxx&password=xxxxx&BenchmarkTest02635=bar'+and+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02651?username=qqqq&password=qqqq&BenchmarkTest02651=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02651
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02651 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.

Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 't'='r which evaluates to false. The payload is barxxx' or 't'='r

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02651?username=qqqq&password=qqqq&BenchmarkTest02651=barxxx'+or+'t'%3d'r HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the second boolean false condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the first boolean false condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean true condition payloads.

Reason 3:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is bar' and 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02651?username=qqqq&password=qqqq&BenchmarkTest02651=bar'+and+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'and' followed by the SQL condition 7=5-- which evaluates to false. The payload is bar' and 7=5--

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02650?username=qqqq&password=qqqq&BenchmarkTest02650=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02650
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02650 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02650?username=qqqq&password=qqqq&BenchmarkTest02650=barxxx'+or+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Reason 2:

Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. False Positive Check Assistance:

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02653?username=vvvvv&password=vvvvv&BenchmarkTest02653=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02653
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02653 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 8=8--
Payload B - barxxx' or 7=5--
Payload C - barxxx' or 7=7--
Payload D - barxxx' or 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 8=8-- which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 8=8--

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02653?username=vvvvv&password=vvvvv&BenchmarkTest02653=barxxx'+or+8%3d8-- HTTP/1.1
Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745



Information about the Response from the Server:

This response is the result of the first boolean true condition based payload. This response is equal to the response of the second boolean true condition payload and different from the responses of the boolean false condition payloads.

Information about the Response from the Server:

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.

SQL Injection Detected
<<<>>>
Type:Vulnerability
Severity:High
Confidence:Medium
Found By:Active Scanning

Affected Site:http://127.0.0.1:8080/
Affected Url:/benchmark/sqli-06/BenchmarkTest02649?username=qqqq&password=qqqq&BenchmarkTest02649=bar
Affected Parameter:BenchmarkTest02649
Parameter Location:Query
Description:
SQL Injection was identified in the BenchmarkTest02649 parameter of the Query section of the scanned request.

SQL Injection is an issue where it is possible execute SQL queries on the database being used on the server-side. For more details on this issue refer https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection

Reasons:
IronWASP has reported this issue because of the following reasons:
Reason 1:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - barxxx' or 's'='s
Payload B - barxxx' or 's'='r
Payload C - barxxx' or 't'='t
Payload D - barxxx' or 't'='r
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the OR keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
The relevant parts of the requests/responses pairs associated with the check explained in this reason section are available below.
Request sent by Scanner:

The payload in this request contains the conditional operator 'or' followed by the SQL condition 's'='s which evaluates to true. The payload is barxxx' or 's'='s

[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]
Cookie: JSESSIONID=1A07AA987B519672B9A12AC39C315745

[---- Snipped parts of HTTP headers section for brevity ----]

Reason 2:
IronWASP sent four payloads to the application with SQL code snippets in them.
Payload A - bar' and 8=8--
Payload B - bar' and 7=5--
Payload C - bar' and 7=7--
Payload D - bar' and 5=8--
Payload A and C have a boolean condition after the AND keyword that will evaluate to true. The boolean condition in Payload B and D would evaluate to false.
The response for Payload A and C were similar to each other and were different from the response received for Payload B and D. This indicates that the application was actually evaluating the boolean condition in the payloads. So since Payload A and C both has a true boolean condition their responses are similar, C and D had a false boolean condition.
If the application was not actually evaluating the boolean condition then all four payload should have returned very similar responses. Therefore this indicates that SQL syntax from the payload is executed as part of the SQL query on the server.
False Positive Check Assistance:
Manually analyze the responses received for the four payloads and confirm if the type of similarity explained above actually exists in them. Try resending the same payloads again but with values in the boolean expression and check if this behaviour is repeated.
If you discover that this issue was a false positive then please consider reporting this to lava@ironwasp.org. Your feedback will help improve the accuracy of the scanner.
